DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS Pediatric Physical Health Pain Interference 3793R1r Past 7 Days Trouble Sleeping When in Pain Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated response in the past 7 days about how much trouble sleeping was when they had pain, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Pediatric and Parent Proxy Physical Health Domain Pain Interference Subordinate Domain Past Week Trouble Sleeping When in Pain Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The set of PROMIS measures that assess the physical health of pediatric subjects through self-report or parent proxy report._The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess the consequences of pain on relevant aspects of a person's life, including the impact of pain on social, cognitive, emotional, physical, and recreational activities as well as sleep and enjoyment in life.:The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about whether a person had trouble sleeping when they had pain._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: PROMIS Pediatric and Parent Proxy Physical Health Domain Pain Interference Subordinate Domain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The set of PROMIS measures that assess the physical health of pediatric subjects through self-report or parent proxy report._The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess the consequences of pain on relevant aspects of a person's life, including the impact of pain on social, cognitive, emotional, physical, and recreational activities as well as sleep and enjoyment in life.

Concepts.longName: PROMIS Pediatric and Parent Proxy Physical Health Domain
Concepts.definition: The set of PROMIS measures that assess the physical health of pediatric subjects through self-report or parent proxy report.

The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess the consequences of pain on relevant aspects of a person's life, including the impact of pain on social, cognitive, emotional, physical, and recreational activities as well as sleep and enjoyment in life.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Trouble Sleeping When in Pain Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether a person had trouble sleeping when they had pain.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about whether a person had trouble sleeping when they had pain.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PROMIS:Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System, PROMIS Health Organization and PROMIS Cooperative Group
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 11/28/23_Created new to exclude Form Name concept_smt

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores from 1 (Never) to 5 (Always).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On many occasions, or in many situations.

Concepts.definition: On many occasions, or in many situations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: I had trouble sleeping when I had pain
